--- title: "Linear Models" format: revealjs: scrollable: true theme: [default, styles.scss] navigation-mode: vertical controls-layout: bottom-right controls-tutorial: true incremental: false chalkboard: src: notes/chalkboard_1a.json storage: chalkboard_pres theme: whiteboard chalk-width: 4 knitr: opts_chunk: echo: false eval: true message: false warnings: false comment: "#>" revealjs-plugins: - pointer - verticator filters: - reveal-header - code-fullscreen - reveal-auto-agenda auto-agenda: bullets: numbered heading: Learning Outcomes editor: visual --- # Announcements ## Scorpio Season is Here!! The first 6 reading assignments and quizzes are open for retakes until October 31! ::: fragment **This is your last chance!!** ::: ::: fragment **No more new chances will be coming for remaining of semester.** ::: ::: fragment **Other Assignment are still due.** ::: ## Plotathon ![](img/PAT24%20L&L%20Tools%20Workshop.png){fig-align="center"} ## Wednesday's Class Is Cancelled. But, I encourage you to attend the LRC during this time to learn more about empty models and linear models. ::: fragment Devin and Amanda may hold extra sessions. ::: # Linear Models ## Motivation: Danceability ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ## Empty Model 1. Find the Mean of all the data 2. $$ \hat Y_i = mean $$ 3. The predicted value is $\hat Y_i$ ## Find the Empty Model ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ## SSE of the Empty Model $$ SSE = \sum^n_{i=1}(Y_i-\hat Y_i)^2 $$ 1. For each data point 1. Find the predicted value 2. Obtain the residual value ($Y_i-\hat Y_i$) 3. Square the residual $(Y_i-\hat Y_i)^2$ 2. Repeat the process for all data points 3. Add up all the squared Residuals ## Compute SSE for the Data ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: $$ \hat Y_i = 0.567 $$ ## Modelling Danceability with Album We want to see if album can explain danceability. ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ## Modelling an outcome with categorical 1. Compute the means for each group 2. Identify the number of predictor variables (inputs, independent, X, Z, ...) to explain the outcome variable (Y) 1. You need one less the number of categories 3. Construct the generic model 1. $\hat Y_i = b_0 + b_1 X$: for 2 categories 2. $\hat Y_i = b_0 + b_1 X + b_2Z$: for 3 categories 3. $\hat Y_i = b_0 + b_1 X + b_2 Z + b_3 A + \cdots$ : for 4 or more categories 4. Define each variable to indicate category 1. $1$: for a specific category 2. $0$: for other 3. Known as indicator variable 5. Set the mean for each group equal to the model with appropriate indicator variable values 6. Solve for the coefficients $b_0, b_1, b_2, \ldots$ using algebra 7. Construct final model with numerical values ## Model Danceability with Albums ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ## SSE of the Model $$ SSE = \sum^n_{i=1}(Y_i-\hat Y_i)^2 $$ 1. For each data point 1. Find the predicted value 2. Obtain the residual value ($Y_i-\hat Y_i$) 3. Square the residual $(Y_i-\hat Y_i)^2$ 2. Repeat the process for all data points 3. Add up all the squared Residuals ## Compute the SSE for the Model ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: $$ \hat Y_i = 0.6185 - 0.0455 X - 0.1095 Z $$ $$ Z = \left\{\begin{array}{cc} 1 & Speak\ Now\\ 0 & Other \end{array} \right. $$ $$ X = \left\{\begin{array}{cc} 1 & Midnights\\ 0 & Other \end{array} \right. $$

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
